6. GRANT OF TRADEMARK LICENSE
6.1 Arizona Licensed Trademark Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Arizona hereby grants to the Company a limited, non- exclusive, royalty-free, non-sublicensable (except as set forth in Section 7.1), non-assignable license in, to and under the Arizona Licensed Trademarks for the Arizona Trademark License Term for use in the Company Field throughout the world only in the form and manner that such Arizona Licensed Trademarks are used in the Business as of the Closing, provided that the Company shall use commercially reasonable efforts to present the Arizona Licensed Trademarks in the form set forth on Schedule 6.1.
perturbation.changed_text:
6. GRANT OF TRADEMARK LICENSE
6.1 Arizona Licensed Trademark Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Arizona hereby grants to the Company a limited, exclusive, royalty-free, fully sublicensable license in, to and under the Arizona Licensed Trademarks for the Arizona Trademark License Term for use in the Company Field throughout the world in any form or manner the Company deems appropriate. The Company is not required to adhere to the presentation format outlined in Schedule 6.1.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants a 'non-exclusive, non-sublicensable, non-assignable' license, restricting the Company's usage. The modification grants an 'exclusive, fully sublicensable' license and removes restrictions on usage form, directly contradicting the original terms.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1 Sublicenses. Arizona may sublicense the licenses granted herein to its Affiliates and Third Parties in the ordinary course of business in support of its and its Affiliates' business, but not for the independent use of Third Parties, and the Company may sublicense the licenses granted herein to Third Parties, its Subsidiaries, AWP, controlled Affiliates, or any holding company that is a direct or indirect parent of the Company in the ordinary course of business in support of its and its Subsidiaries' or controlled Affiliates' business, but not for the independent use of Third Parties (each such Affiliate, Third Party, AWP or Subsidiary, a "Sublicensee"). Each Party shall ensure that any sublicense that it grants to a Sublicensee does not conflict with this Agreement. For clarity, granting a sublicense shall not relieve the Parties of any obligations hereunder and each Party shall cause each of its Sublicensees to comply, and shall remain responsible for such Sublicensees' compliance, with all terms and conditions hereof applicable to the Parties. At the request of a licensing Party, the other Party shall provide to the licensing Party a list of all Sublicensees and otherwise reasonably cooperate with the licensing Party in connection with Sublicensees' compliance with this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 Sublicenses. Neither Arizona nor the Company may sublicense any licenses granted herein to any party under any circumstances. Any attempt to sublicense will be considered a material breach of this agreement. Arizona and the Company are strictly prohibited from providing a list of sublicensees or any information relating to sublicensees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly allows both Arizona and the Company to grant sublicenses under certain conditions. The modified text completely prohibits sublicensing, creating a direct contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Term and Termination. (a) Unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provisions hereof, the term of this Agreement and the licenses and other grants of rights (and related obligations) under this Agreement shall (i) with respect to the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, be for the Arizona Trademark License Term, (ii) with respect to the Diamond Licensed Trademarks, be for the Diamond Trademark License Term, (iii) with respect to the Phase- Out Marks, be for the term set forth in Section 6.6, and (iv) with respect to Copyrights, Know-How and Patents, be in perpetuity.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 Term and Termination. (a) Unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provisions hereof, the term of this Agreement and the licenses and other grants of rights (and related obligations) under this Agreement shall (i) with respect to the Arizona Licensed Trademarks, be for the Arizona Trademark License Term, (ii) with respect to the Diamond Licensed Trademarks, be for the Diamond Trademark License Term, (iii) with respect to the Phase- Out Marks, be for the term set forth in Section 6.6, and (iv) with respect to Copyrights, Know-How and Patents, shall automatically terminate one year from the effective date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the licenses for Copyrights, Know-How, and Patents are granted 'in perpetuity,' meaning forever. The modified text states these licenses 'shall automatically terminate one year from the effective date,' directly contradicting the perpetual nature initially granted.
